title: Doublelift VS Froggen  (explained)
body: So as many of you saw the insane win for doublelift. On game 2 of Bo3 vs froggen. This game would have won the Bo3 for doublelift. Riot called a rematch and doublelift agreed to it. But  this was actually a legitimate win by doublelift! As we know, the snowball deals damage which should stop the recall animation for doubleift right!? Well NO!! not exactly! In the recall animation you are able to take damage for the lat 0.5 seconds of the recall WITHOUT canceling the recal. That is what we saw there! we saw froggen hit doublelift with the snowball in that 0.5 window! He then activated the second part of the snowball while doublelift was actually going to base! This is a legitimate win and was such a crazy strike of luck but this was not a game glitch! What a crazy game!

Didnt Riot even confirm that if you recall in a recent change that there is a point to where a recall cannot be interrupted by damage?

EDIT: http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/V5.12
Less recent than I thought, but check this out.

_Grace period at the end of recall normalized to 0.1 seconds from a random amount between 0 and 0.25 seconds._

That patch was last year, and Snowdown Showdown was two years ago; it's likely that patch wasn't applied to the Showdown mode. Certainly in the first game, the recall delay was way more than .1 second.
